column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Today was the official opening of the Modern Wing
column3: I was impressed. The structure is a radical departure from the 19th century building that forms the main body of the Art Institute
column4: but it's the perfect setting for contemporary art. While I don't love the exterior
column5: the interior of Renzo Piano's building feels airy and bright
column6: and natural light permeates the space. Contemporary architects have a penchant for concrete
column7: but I was happy to find that the floors and staircases here are dominated by blond wood
column8: which makes the galleries feel welcoming instead of sterile. And the Modern Wing alone seems larger than the entire Museum of Contemporary Art
column9: though I don't know the actual square footage of either structure.
